title: TTU rides Toppin gem to upset of No. 1 Arizona
content: Texas Tech's JT Toppin finished Saturday's upset overtime win vs. No. 1 Arizona with 31 points, 13 rebounds, three assists, two steals and a block.

title: Silver considering all fixes for NBA's tanking issue
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver called tanking the worst it has been in "recent memory" and said he is not ruling out any potential remedy, including taking away draft picks, to stop it.

title: Dame claims 3rd title; Johnson wins dunk contest
content: Damian Lillard, nine months after undergoing surgery on his torn Achilles, won his third All-Star 3-point contest to tie with Larry Bird and Craig Hodges for the most ever.

title: A. Kim scores first win since 2010 in LIV stunner
content: Anthony Kim, who needed to play a qualifying tournament last month just to get another season on the LIV Tour, capped a remarkable career comeback by winning LIV Golf Adelaide.

title: Klaebo sets Olympic record, wins 9th XXC gold
content: Norway's Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo has won a ninth gold medal in cross-country skiing, setting a Winter Games record.

title: Brignone wins Olympic giant slalom; Shiffrin 11th
content: Federica Brignone captured her second gold medal in four days at her home Winter Olympics by winning the women's giant slalom on Sunday, as Mikaela Shiffrin finished off the podium again.

title: Sources: MAC to add Sac State for football in '26
content: The MAC presidents have voted to add FCS Sacramento State into the league as a football-only member starting in 2026, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Raiders promote Crosby coach Leonard
content: The Raiders are promoting run game coordinator/defensive line coach Rob Leonard to defensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: HRD Minister Lokesh expresses solidarity with ‚Äòkova bun‚Äô vendor
content: Reacting to the viral video clip wherein the vendor from Kurnool district was allegedly forced by a group of YouTubers at Medaram Jatara to eat the delicacy he prepared to prove he was not resorting to ‚Äòfood jihad‚Äô, the HRD Minister, while expressing regret, says he looks forward to meeting Brother Vali and tasting the famous bun

title: Govt. medical college doctors to go on indefinite strike from Monday
content: The strike will include a long-term boycott of outpatient clinical services as well as all academic activities. From February 19, the doctors will boycott indefinitely non-emergency surgeries and other elective procedures also

title: Yadgir MLA writes to CM seeking funds for infrastructure development
content: Channareddy Patil Tunnur has submitted a requisition to the Chief Minister urging him to earmark ‚Çπ585.28 crore in the State Budget

title: Drug pushers‚Äô attempt to lure children in juvenile homes in Kozhikode under scanner
content: The action follows the recent rescue of a missing 16-year-old boy from the company of a gang of suspected drug pushers in the city

content: Temples were adorned with decorative ‚Äúthoranams‚Äù and ‚Äúmandapams‚Äù, while flex boards depicting Lord Siva and Goddess Parvati were installed at various locations

title: TMC‚Äôs solo posture in Parliament is strategy, not a snub to the INDIA bloc
content: With the West Bengal Assembly election around the corner, Parliament is another platform for the TMC‚Äôs electoral campaign; its MPs are focussed on asserting their independence and Bangla identity

title: Survey records 17 active White-bellied Sea Eagle nests in Kannur, Kasaragod
content: Despite the improvement, officials say the current figure remained below historical levels. Records from 1996 showed 25 active nesting sites, suggesting that the population has yet to fully recover

title: Complaints over dredging in Korapuzha: Assistant Collector to lead expert team
content: The move follows complaints by residents and political parties alleging that sand was being illegally extracted and sludge was dumped unscientifically in nearby areas

title: Devotees throng Srisailam temple on Mahasivaratri
content: Darshan of the presiding deities started from 2.20 a.m. and at least 2.50 lakh devotees visited the temple town on the day, says Nandyal Collector

content: Allocation ‚Çπ143 crore higher than previous year, focus on SHG empowerment, rural livelihoods and One Family One Entrepreneur initiative to support five lakh women, he says

content: Herath festival in Kashmir sees displaced Kashmiri Pandits celebrate while Muslims recount memories of brotherhood

content: Swami Anandavanam Bharati Maharaj, the Mahamandaleshwar of the Juna Akhara, inaugurated the eight-day event

title: Arippa protesters urge Kerala government to halt collection of rubber tree dues
content: Demand ahead of proposed title deed distribution intended to resolve long-standing Arippa land struggle. Notice issued to families living on revenue land, according to which they have to pay for rubber and miscellaneous trees standing on plots they currently occupy

title: Explain budget‚Äôs vision and objectives to the people, Palla Srinivasa Rao urges coalition party leaders
content: With development, welfare, and wealth creation as its core pillars, the budget aims at ensuring balanced and sustainable growth, while laying emphasis on social justice, says the TDP State president

title: Shivaji-Tipu remarks: BJP, Congress workers pelt stones in Pune, 9 injured; cops to book both sides
content: Congress has alleged that two of its workers sustained injuries as activists from the saffron party indulged in stone pelting outside the Congress Bhavan

content: He says what pressures worked on CPI leadership to accept for alliance with Congress knowing well that the ruling party is exploiting Singareni Collieries along with BJP

title: Group detained for bid to enter fort in Kalaburagi for Shivaratri puja
content: It said it wanted to carry out special prayers at the Sri Swayambhu Someshwar Temple located inside the fort premises

title: LJP(RV) protests RJD MLA‚Äôs comment against Ram Vilas Pawan, burns Tejashwi Yadav's effigy
content: Protesters called the RJD anti-Dalit and burnt the effigy of RJD's national working president, Tejashwi Yadav. RJD MLA from Bodh Gaya Constituency, Kumar Sarvjeet, had on February 11 described LJP founder and former Union Minister Ram Vilas Paswan as a "Bechara" (pitiable) in the context of his political journey

title: Freshly Dug Soil, Raw Meat Found At 3-Year-Old's Grave In Chhattisgarh
content: A sense of fear and outrage has taken over Mahudbi village in Chhattisgarh's Balod district after a grave of a three-year-old girl, who was buried three months ago, was disturbed in the middle of the night.

title: PM On How India Settled Recent Trade Deals, Then A Jab At Congress-Led UPA
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said today that India had negotiated trade pacts from a position of strength because of its strength in manufacturing, service sector and Small and Medium Enterprises.

title: "Reforms, Innovation, Simpler Governance": PM Modi's 3 Priorities For Next Decade
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said his top three reform priorities for the next decade will be continued structural reforms, deepening innovation and further simplification of governance.

title: Bodies Go Missing From Odisha Burial Ground, Probe Ordered: Cops
content: Bodies of five villagers allegedly went missing from a graveyard in Odisha's Bhadrak district, prompting the authorities to order a detailed investigation, a police officer said on Sunday.

title: Budget Shunned Populism, Bets On Capex To Power Jobs, Growth: PM Modi
content: Calling productive spending a hallmark of his government, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said the just unveiled Union Budget deliberately avoided short-term populism and instead channelled record capital outlays into infrastructure.

title: Sadhguru's Shout-Out To Gautam Adani On Maha Shivratri
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has extended his best wishes on the auspicious occasion of Maha Shivratri.The billionaire has shared a picture of himself offering prayers to Adiyogi, the Lord Shiva bust, at Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, on X.

title: On Camera, Rajasthan Constable Celebrates Wedding With 'Wanted' Criminals
content: A Rajasthan Police constable's career ended just two days after his wedding, because of his guests. Ashok Bishnoi was dismissed from service after a viral video revealed that several notorious criminals attended his wedding.

title: Centre To Scale Up "AI For All" Programme, Top Institute To Launch Campaign
content: India's top research institution - the Indian Council For Social Science Research (ICSSR) -- will launch a nationwide campaign to promote Artificial Intelligence among young people in the country.

title: Student Dies By Suicide In Durgapur Medical College
content: The body of a medical student has been found from the bathroom of the hostel of the IQ City Medical College Hospital, a private medical college in West Bengal's Durgapur, where a junior medical student was allegedly gang-raped months ago.

title: Punjab BJP Leader Arvind Khanna Joins Shiromani Akali Dal
content: Bharatiya Janata Party leader Arvind Khanna on Sunday joined the Shiromani Akali Dal in the presence of party chief Sukhbir Singh Badal in Sangrur.

title: "There's This Sort Of Clown Show": Obama After Trump's Racist Monkey Clip
content: Former US president Barack Obama criticised a lack of shame and decorum in the country's political discourse, responding Saturday for the first time to a post on Donald Trump's social media account that depicted him and Michelle as monkeys.

title: Om Birla To Represent India At Tarique Rahman's Oath Ceremony In Bangladesh
content: The Speaker's participation at this important event underscores the deep and enduring friendship between the peoples of India and Bangladesh, the foreign ministry said.

title: Ukraine Ex-Minister Arrested While Fleeing Country Amid Corruption Scandal
content: Ukraine's NABU anti-corruption force said Sunday it arrested the country's former energy minister, German Galushchenko -- who resigned last year during a massive corruption scandal -- as he tried to cross Ukraine's border.

title: Papers From 1995 Shine Light On Nagaland Village Where Violence Broke Out
content: A village in Nagaland's Chumoukedima district where members of an Angami organisation and district officials including a policeman allegedly came under attack on Friday, had got permission from a Chakhro Angami village to settle down in the area.

title: Imran Khan Being Moved From Jail? His Party Says 'Ex-PM's Life At Risk'
content: Adding fuel to the already contentious issue of Imran Khan's health, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) claimed that its founder and former Prime Minister of Pakistan is being secretly moved from jail to a hospital for medical treatment.

title: India Has Potential To Lead In AI: Sam Altman Ahead Of AI Impact Summit
content: In a major endorsement of India's growing role in artificial intelligence, Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, has described India as a potential "full-stack AI leader" and announced plans to expand the company's presence and partnerships in the country.

title: Why India's C-130J Is King Of Tactical Airlift Missions: 10 Points
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed on the northeast's first emergency landing field (ELF) in an Indian Air Force C-130J Super Hercules turboprop aircraft. This rugged transport plane is ideal for operating in difficult terrain, common in India.

title: 2,000-Year-Old Iron Age Temple Discovered In Denmark
content: A temple and fortified settlement were found in Denmark's Central region during a research being conducted by Museum Midtjylland.

title: 40,000-Year-Old Sealed Cave Opened In Gibraltar. Here's What Was Found
content: The Vanguard Cave in the Gorham's Cave Complex has been an area of interest among Gibraltar National Museum archaeologists since 2012.

title: What Aviation Body's Revised Breath Analyser Rules Mean For Pilots, Cabin Crew
content: India's aviation regulator has revised its norms on alcohol testing for pilots and cabin crew under the Civil Aviation Requirement (CAR). The revised rules moderate the regulatory baseline.

title: Kerala Judicial Academy to update infra facilities to train its first-ever visually challenged trainee judge
content: The changes are being proposed to support C. Thanya Nathan, a person with no light perception, who was ranked first in the merit list of persons with benchmark disabilities in the recently held judicial service examination for the selection of Civil Judges (Junior Division)

title: Vijayapura hospital successfully carries out kidney transplant

title: SAT hospital‚Äôs paediatric nephrology dept. achieves a major milestone

title: Navalny poisoned? US says won't 'dispute' report, stops short of blaming Russia
content: US secretary of state Marco Rubio stated Washington is not disputing a report by five European nations concluding Alexei Navalny was fatally poisoned. The report identified a rare toxin from a dart frog, with Russia identified as the prime suspect.  Navalny's widow declared his murder a "science-proven fact" after his death in a Russian penal colony.

title: 'Focus less on margins, share gains fairly with workers': PM's strong advise to pvt sector
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized the private sector's crucial role in India's economic future, urging bold investments in innovation and capacity. He highlighted his government's commitment to reforms and decisive governance, while also stressing the need for the private sector to share productivity gains with workers and invest in R&D and quality.

title: A very angry Pentagon to Anthropic: Don't lecture us, you can go and ...
content: The Pentagon is reportedly considering ending its partnership with AI firm Anthropic over restrictions on military use of its technology. Anthropic refuses to allow its AI for mass surveillance of citizens or fully autonomous weapons, frustrating defense officials. While other companies are more accommodating, Anthropic's firm stance on ethical guardrails could lead to a complete termination of their collaboration.

title: Abhishek Sharma falls for four-ball duck in first over vs Pakistan
content: Abhishek Sharma's T20 World Cup struggles persisted as he was dismissed for a duck against Pakistan, caught by the captain himself in the opening over. This follows an earlier duck against the USA, raising concerns about his form. Despite a previous hospitalization, he was included in the playing XI for the crucial match.

title: 'Hallyu' from Seoul: How South Korea's K-wave swept India - and its darker side
content: South Korea's 'Korean Wave' has transformed from a niche phenomenon to a mainstream cultural force in India and across the globe, driven by K-pop, K-dramas, and lifestyle trends. This soft power surge, fueled by digital access and strategic state policy, offers a model for global influence, impacting consumption and aspirations across the nation.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel reveals what developers company will never hire
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: ‚ÄòTouched me repeatedly‚Äô: Bihar man held for molesting co-passenger on Hanoi flight
content: A male passenger, Abdur Rahim, was arrested at Kolkata airport after a co-passenger accused him of repeated inappropriate touching and verbal abuse during a flight from Hanoi. Airline staff intervened, moving the complainant, and handed Rahim over to authorities upon landing. He now faces molestation and verbal abuse charges.

title: Gold, Silver likely to consolidate amid Fed rate-cut uncertainty: Analysts
content: Precious metal prices are set for continued volatility and consolidation as investors await crucial US economic data, including inflation and GDP figures.  Market watchers are closely observing Federal Reserve signals for potential rate cut timelines.  Gold experienced a sharp correction in February, influenced by stronger US employment data, while silver futures saw a decline.

title: Anthropic CEO again tells US govt NOT to do what Nvidia CEO has been 'begging' it for
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei strongly opposes selling advanced AI chips to China, viewing them as a national security risk rather than a trade commodity. He argues that such sales could lead to a dangerous AI arms race, unlike nuclear deterrence. Amodei advocates for distributing AI benefits globally while preventing authoritarian regimes from weaponizing the technology.

title: No handshake at toss: India's stance against Pak continues despite calls for 'spirit'
content: India's captain Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan's skipper Salman Ali Agha skipped the customary handshake at the T20 World Cup toss in Colombo. This continues India's stance, observed since the Asia Cup 2025, sparking debate. While Pakistan expressed openness to the gesture, India's captain remained non-committal, emphasizing a focus on cricket.

title: Bengal man's body cut up, stuffed in bags; BLO admits murder, affair suspected
content: A primary school teacher, Rizwan Hasan Mondal, confessed to murdering Nasir Ali, a Baduria resident, after abducting him. Ali's dismembered body parts were recovered from three water bodies. Police suspect an alleged extramarital affair between Mondal and Ali's wife as the motive. Mondal's associate has also been arrested.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: Kylie Young grabs attention at WM Phoenix Open in summer frock
content: Jack Bech‚Äôs girlfriend Kylie Young used the WM Phoenix Open to quietly own the offseason, sharing sundress and golf-day looks that stood out while the Las Vegas Raiders regroup from a 3-14 year. From Phoenix to Aspen and Raiders game days, her Instagram keeps building a separate highlight reel around the rookie wide receiver.

title: Candace Owens calls claims about Erika Kirk 'absolutely vile'
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens‚Äô use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: India-UK trade agreement likely to come into force in April: Report
content: India and the UK's free trade agreement, signed last year, is slated for implementation by April 2026. This pact promises 99% duty-free access for Indian exports to Britain, while India will lower tariffs on cars and whisky.  Parliamentary approval is currently underway in the UK, paving the way for enhanced bilateral trade.

title: J&K crackdown: 8,000+ mule accounts frozen; anti-national activities suspected
content: Jammu and Kashmir security agencies have frozen over 8,000 mule accounts in three years, identifying them as crucial for global scam networks and potential funding of anti-national activities. These accounts facilitate the conversion of stolen money into untraceable cryptocurrency, with authorities urging banks and law enforcement to curb their rise and identify "mulers" who manage them.

title: 'Psychological edge already ours': Former Pakistan captain makes bold claim
content: Former Pakistan captain Mohammad Hafeez believes the intense focus on spinner Usman Tariq provides a psychological edge over India. Hafeez suggests the debate surrounding Tariq's bowling action is causing "panic" in the Indian camp, forcing them to specifically prepare for him. He urged Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha to use Tariq aggressively to maximize his game-changing potential.

title: 'Deep friendship': Birla, Misri to attend Tarique Rahman's oath-taking in Dhaka
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will represent India at the swearing-in of Bangladesh's PM-elect Tarique Rahman, following the BNP's landslide victory. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri will accompany Birla. This event marks a significant diplomatic shift for Dhaka, especially after former PM Sheikh Hasina's ouster and subsequent exile in India. The new BNP government's stance will be closely observed.

title: 18,000 Indians, 12,000 Pakistanis, and 2,000 SL Police: Scale of India-Pakistan showdown
content: Tens of thousands of Indian and Pakistani fans have converged on Colombo for the high-voltage India-Pakistan clash, turning the city into a fortress with massive security deployment. Beyond politics and critique, the match has energised local livelihoods, packed the stadium to capacity and reaffirmed why this rivalry remains cricket‚Äôs most powerful spectacle.

title: Rijiju sets March 9 debate on no-confidence against Birla; Nehru‚Äôs 1954 message resurfaces
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju announced that the Lok Sabha will debate and vote on a no-confidence motion against the Speaker on March 9. This follows a submission by 118 Congress MPs alleging partisan conduct. Historically, such motions against Speakers are rare, with past instances including those against GV Mavalankar, Sardar Hukum Singh, and Balram Jakhar.

title: Mrunal Thakur reacts to marriage rumours with Dhanush
content: Mrunal Thakur recently reacted to rumours of her marriage with Dhanush, calling them amusing. She said love will happen when the time is right and joked, ‚ÄúWoh to shaadi ho rahi hai.‚Äù Mrunal added she had to hire a PR team after her address leaked and thanked those ‚Äúspreading fake rumours‚Äù for free publicity.

title: Soap opera over soap: Why Karnataka politics is in a ‚Äòlather‚Äô over iconic Mysuru brand
content: At the heart of the row is Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited (KSDL), the government-owned company that manufactures Mysuru Sandal Soap. Founded during the reign of Nalwadi Krishnaraja Wadiyar, the brand is not merely a commercial product. For many Kannadigas, it is an aromatic symbol of heritage. Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP K Sudhakar accused the Congress-led Karnataka government of displaying what he called an ‚Äúanti-Kannada mindset‚Äù.

title: Babar-Rizwan masterclass to 'Kohli goes down the ground': How Ind & Pak have fared in 2020s
content: India and Pakistan's T20 World Cup encounters have been closely contested, despite India's 7-1 head-to-head record. Recent matches in the 2020s, including the 2021 loss, the thrilling 2022 victory, and the tight 2024 win, highlight decisive moments rather than one-sided dominance.

title: 'Betraying farmers' vs 'spreading lies': Rahul Gandhi, Amit Shah clash over India‚ÄìUS deal
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Modi government of betraying farmers through the India-US trade deal, raising concerns about GM maize imports and potential pressure on Indian crops. Union Home Minister Amit Shah refuted these claims, calling them lies and asserting that farmers' interests are protected in trade agreements with the US, EU, and UK.

title: Lulu Retail to open 50 new stores across Middle East: Hundreds of jobs up for grabs
content: Lulu Retail is set to open 50 new stores across the GCC by 2028, bolstering its presence with hypermarkets and smaller formats. This ambitious expansion, following record revenues, promises hundreds of jobs and aims to enhance accessibility to essentials. The move signifies Lulu's commitment to both physical and digital retail growth, adapting to evolving consumer habits in the region.

title: Global cues, AI disruption fears to steer markets this week: Analysts
content: Stock markets are poised for a volatile week, driven by US economic data, the Federal Reserve's policy outlook, and growing AI disruption fears. Analysts anticipate a cautious sentiment as investors monitor global geopolitical events and currency movements. Domestic sectors like banking and automobiles may gain traction, while broader indices are expected to trade sideways awaiting clearer economic signals.

title: Dubai‚Äôs Ramadan 2026 plans revealed: 30 days of fireworks, drone shows, cultural events
content: Dubai is set to host a spectacular Ramadan 2026, commencing February 19th or 20th, with a vibrant calendar blending spiritual observance and city-wide festivities. Expect dazzling drone light shows and fireworks illuminating the night sky, alongside cultural installations and community gatherings. These events aim to unite residents and visitors in a celebration of light, art and shared experiences.

title: Travis Kelce retirement talk gets emotional as Donna Kelce shares views
content: Travis Kelce retirement speculation has intensified after a frustrating season and missed playoffs. Donna Kelce urged her son to follow his heart, while the Chiefs remain hopeful he returns. Kelce admitted he is still searching for answers, balancing his love for football with physical recovery and personal life changes. His decision will shape not just his future, but also the Chiefs‚Äô path forward.

title: Doctor explains how neuroblastoma is often mistaken for weight gain due to swollen belly
content: A child's slightly enlarged belly can be an early, subtle sign of neuroblastoma, a rare cancer primarily affecting young children. This cancer often grows in the abdomen, and initial symptoms like a rounded tummy, vague stomach pain, or fatigue can be easily mistaken for common childhood issues. Early detection is crucial for better treatment outcomes.

title: India-US trade deal to help secure crude at competitive prices: Piyush Goyal
content: India and the US aim to boost bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030, with energy imports like crude oil and LNG forming a key part. This interim trade agreement will help India secure competitive energy prices and diversify suppliers. The pact also focuses on increasing steel, coking coal, and IT exports, enhancing market access for Indian goods.

title: Kanpur Lamborghini crash: No need to question tobacco baron's son Shivam Mishra anymore, says IO
content: Police investigating a Lamborghini crash in Kanpur stated no further interrogation of accused Shivam Kumar Mishra is needed, as all required questioning was completed at his arrest. Mishra, son of a local businessman, was granted bail hours after his arrest, with the court directing his cooperation in the ongoing investigation.

title: Speeding Thar crashes into police patrol vehicle near Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's residence
content: A major tragedy was averted in Patna's VVIP area when an over-speeding SUV collided with a police patrol vehicle near the chief minister's residence. The forceful impact damaged both vehicles, with the SUV smashing through a guardrail. While a female police officer sustained injuries, others were safe, and four individuals were detained for questioning.

title: FPIs infuse Rs 19,675 crore in early February after months of heavy selling
content: Foreign investors injected Rs 19,675 crore into Indian stocks in early February, reversing months of outflows. This surge, driven by a US-India trade deal and easing global economic worries, signals renewed optimism. Despite this, overall 2025 flows remain weak, with significant net outflows recorded year-to-date.

title: Rajkummar Rao‚Äôs new look sparks concern as viral video leave fans surprised
content: Rajkummar Rao's recent appearance at a film festival has sparked online buzz due to a noticeable change in his hair and facial features. Sporting a patchy beard and thinner hair, fans expressed shock and concern, with some struggling to recognize the actor. Speculation suggests this transformation might be preparation for his role in the upcoming Sourav Ganguly biopic.

title: 'White-collar' terror probe: Doctors formed 'Ansar Interim' to carry out attacks
content: A new terror outfit, 'Ansar Interim,' formed by radicalised doctors, has been exposed by J&K Police. The group, allegedly linked to Al-Qaeda, planned subversive activities, including IED attacks. Investigations revealed procurement of explosive materials and attempts to recruit members, with a key operative planning a VBIED blast.

title: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar urges devotees to embrace meditation on Mahashivratri
content: Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar urged deep inner reflection and devotion this Mahashivratri, emphasizing meditation and chanting to elevate spiritual practice. Prime Minister Modi and defence minister Rajnath Singh extended greetings, praying for well-being and prosperity. The festival celebrates the divine union of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati, observed with reverence across India.

title: WNBA mock draft: Who follows Azzi Fudd at No. 1?
content: the WNBA and players' association continue negotiating a new collective bargaining agreement . most players not under rookie contracts are free agents, plus there are two expansion teams that don't have any players yet . we are projecting draft selections without important context about the players they will be joining .

title: Two games, two wins: Grades, big questions after Team USA's dramatic win over Denmark
content: the game was much more dramatic than many had predicted, but the result was a 6-3 win for the united states over Denmark . team USA trailed 2-1 after the first period, before roaring back to score three in the second . the netminder allowed three goals on just 12 shots, one being a center-ice strike by rugged Danish league defender Nick Jensen .

title: IND vs PAK: Ishan Kishan smashes Yuvraj Singh's record to rattle Pakistan in Colombo
content: At TOI Sports Desk, reporters work around the clock to bring you comprehensive updates from the world of sports. title: 11 draft prospects with a true first-round grade
content: the average draft class has roughly 15 players who are deemed "first-round talents" a player would have been a first-rounder in each of the past five classes . the 2026 class actually has fewer players at the moment .

title: Way-Too-Early All-America team: Forecasting college football's top players in 2026
content: the Longhorns finished 10-3 last season and missed the college football Playoff . the 2026 Way-Too-Early All-America team is a tough position to pick just one player . quarterback arch Manning, receiver Cam Coleman and linebackers Colin Simmons and Rasheem Biles are on the team .

title: Bank holidays in Feb 2026: Are banks closed next week? Check state-wise list

title: USA defeats Denmark 6-3: Top moments from Olympic men's hockey
content: Emily Kaplan talks with Noah Hanifin, Matt Boldy and Jake Guentzel following the U.S men's hockey team's 6-3 win over Denmark. (0:54) After a commanding  5-1 win  over Latvia, the United States men's hockey team was back in action for Game 2 of the preliminary round in the 2026 Olympics. Saturday's game was against Denmark, which lost 3-1 to Germany in its first game. The United States won, 6-3. The U.S. now sits atop Group C, with six points. The top team from each group gets a bye into the quarterfinal round of the tournament, which begins Wednesday. Center  Brock Nelson  led the U.S. in scoring after one game, with two goals, while forwards  Jack Eichel ,  Jack Hughes ,  Matthew Tkachuk  and defenseman  Quinn Hughes  all had two assists. Forwards  Auston Matthews ,  Tage Thompson  and  Brady Tkachuk  were the other goal scorers in the opening contest. More:  Men's hockey megapreview  |  Lapsed fan's guide  |  Player rankings

title: Kyle Tucker's Dodgers contract: Final blow for labor peace?
content: a group of fans are angry at baseball . they are inside of group chats that talk about how much money the Los Angeles Dodgers are spending . owners blame the system that governs Major League Baseball . a salary cap would juiper the game, owners say .

title: Olympics men's hockey daily: U.S., Canada back in action Sunday
content: Sunday is the final preliminary day of the men's ice hockey tournament at the 2026 Olympics in Milan Cortina . on Wednesday, Slovakia defeated Finland 4-1 in the first game of the tournament . Saturday's slate featured another convincing win for Canada, as well as victories for Finland, Czechia and Slovakia .

title: Slam dunks, global games, emerging stars: The biggest takeaways from All-Star Weekend
content: the 2026 NBA All-Star Game tipped off with a plethora of superstar players arriving for a jam-packed weekend . the young troupe was headlined by Rookie of the Year contender VJ Edgecombe . Damian Lillard took home the 3-point contest despite an Achilles injury .

title: Big boost for Assam: CM Himanta says Rs 55,000cr projects cleared in last one year
content: central projects worth around Rs 55,000 crore have been sanctioned for the state over the past year . he linked the developments to the commitments made during the second Advantage Assam investment summit . the state has already received approval for different projects worth Rs 55.000 crore .

title: Purr-manent resident: Larry the cat marks 15 years at Downing Street as Britain‚Äôs political top cat
content: Larry the tabby arrived at downing street on febr. 15, 2011 . the gray-and-white tabby was adopted from battersea dogs and cats home by then-Prime minister . since then, he has served under six prime ministers .
